components.description:
A person going for a walk. Taking a slow-medium pace, this person would be a runner if they picked up their speed.

This emoji does not specify a gender, but was previously shown as a man on most major platforms.
components.title: Pedestrian

description:
A person going for a walk. Taking a slow-medium pace, this person would be a runner if they picked up their speed.

This emoji does not specify a gender, but was previously shown as a man on most major platforms.
title: Pedestrian

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A going for a walk. Taking a slow-medium pace, this person would be a runner if they picked up their speed. This emoji is intended to be gen http://emojipedia.org/pedestrian/
emoji_net_data.name: person walking

bn:00113691a: Close enough to be walked to

bn:00089337v: To walk a long way, as for pleasure or physical exercise.
To take a long walk for pleasure or exercise.
Walk a long way, as for pleasure or physical exercise

bn:00095597v: To move from one place to another by moving legs alternately, so that at least one foot is in contact with the floor or surface at any one time.
Use one's feet to advance; advance by steps

bn:00094337v: Shift or move by taking a step

bn:00001530n: A woman is a female human.
An animal of the sex that produces eggs.
An adult human member of the sex that produces ova and bears young.
An adult female person (as opposed to a man)

bn:00012569n: A boy is a young male human, usually child or adolescent.
A young male person, usually a child or teenager.
A young male human; a male child or young adult.

bn:00046516n: A person, especially as one among many.
An individual is a person or a specific object.
A single physical human being as a legal subject, as opposed to a legal person such as a corporation.
A human; someone susceptible to death.

A person is a being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood, which in turn is defined differently by different authors in different disciplines, and by different cultures in different times and places.
A person that will die eventually.
A being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood
Abstract term defining a being, e.g. a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood (not for use with "instance of" [P31], instead use "human" [Q5])
An individual; usually a human being.

bn:00051905n: A loner is a person who avoids or does not actively seek human interaction.
A lone wolf is an animal or person that generally lives or spends time alone instead of with a group.
One who is alone, lacking or avoiding the company of others.
A person who avoids the company or assistance of others
One who lacks or avoids company.
A person who avoids the company or assistance of others.
A person who avoids the company of others; a loner

bn:00001533n: Sexual maturity is the age or stage when an organism can reproduce.
The age or stage when an organism can reproduce
A man is a male human.
An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A human member of the masculine sex or gender.
An adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)

bn:00044137n: Walking in the countryside for pleasure or sport
A long walk usually for exercise or pleasure
Walking as a form of exercise or recreation, especially in a nature setting
Hiking in Canada and the USA is the preferred term for a long, vigorous walk, usually on trails, in the countryside, while the word walking is used for shorter, particularly urban walks.

bn:00080357n: Walking is one of the main gaits of locomotion among legged animals, and is typically slower than running and other gaits.
One of the main gaits of locomotion among legged animals
One of the main gaits of locomotion among legged animals, typically slower than running and other gaits
The act of traveling by foot

apple_vendor_description: The walking person emoji on Apple devices showcases a figure in motion, rendered with Apple’s characteristic smooth gradients and soft, rounded edges. Their posture suggests a steady stride, with subtle shading giving them a realistic, three-dimensional feel and a sense of forward momentum. This emoji is versatile, commonly used to indicate travel, a journey, or simply the act of moving from one place to another, embodying a sense of progress and activity.
